description:
**Join us, be part of more.**
 We’re so much more than an energy company. We’re a family of brands revolutionising how we power the planet. We're energisers. One team of 21,000 colleagues that's energising a greener, fairer future by creating an energy system that doesn’t rely on fossil fuels, whilst living our powerful commitment to igniting positive change in our communities. Here, you can find more purpose, more passion, and more potential. That’s why working here is \#MoreThanACareer. We do energy differently \- we do it all. We make it, store it, move it, sell it, and mend it.
   

  

  

  

**About your team:**
 At Centrica Business Solutions, we’re proud to partner with over 7,000 organisations globally – helping them to balance planet, with profit. We build, operate and maintain onsite, large\-scale energy assets like Solar PV and Combined Heat and Power – to help businesses to save the planet and save money. We’re also transforming the UK’s energy landscape by partnering with landowners and developers to build a 900MW portfolio of new grid\-scale solar farms and battery storage assets.
   

  

 Centrica Business Solutions is a leader in the decentralized energy market, active in the United Kingdom, Europe, North America and other markets. With price predictability a thing of the past, and supply volatility and new energy technologies taking over, we are using our energy expertise to help our customers become environmentally friendly and economically sustainable. Our mission is to build a sustainable power grid, striving to carbon neutrality and halting climate change.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As part of an agile development team, you will develop on the CBS optimization software platform (FlexPond) providing energy services to customers of Centrica Business Solutions and Utility SaaS customers.
   

  

 The focus of this mission is on the settlement process improvement of the FlexPond demand\-response platform, which timeseries and contractual data processing. The mission also gives the opportunity to learn about the challenging power grid rules, regulations and processes regarding ancillary services and wholesale markets.
   

  

 Key Accountabilities
   

  

* Elaboration, design, and development of settlement processes in close collaboration with the product manager and the business stakeholders
* Improvement and creation of settlement\-related services and data\-validation
* Operational support of the settlement back\-office team


 The technology team is in Antwerp\-Berchem (Belgium) at a walking distance from the train station.
   

  

 We offer
   

  

* An (at least) 6\-month contractor mission as part of a team of top developers building a world\-leading distributed energy optimization platform
* An opportunity to work as part of a team focusing on decarbonizing the power grid
* Flexible working hours and 3 days/week home working opportunity
* An international company with the opportunity to travel to other offices from time to time


**About You**
 The ideal profile combines technical excellence with a strong business mindset. A natural curiosity and eagerness to understand the business context drive thoughtful and effective software design. With a broad interest in technology and a fast\-learning attitude, this person thrives in dynamic environments and adapts quickly to new tools and challenges.
   

  

 The ideal candidate will have:
   

  

* A Master’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., IT, science, mathematics, engineering) or equivalent experience demonstrated through a strong professional track record.
* A minimum of 3 years of hands\-on experience in professional Python development.
* Practical experience as a Python data engineer or data analyst, with proficiency in tools such as NumPy, pandas, Jupyter Notebook, and SQL.
* Familiarity with containerization and orchestration technologies, including Docker and Kubernetes.
* Experience working with gRPC and microservice\-based architectures.


 It is an advantage but not a requirement if you have experience with .NET / C\#.
   

  

**Why should you apply?** 
  

  

  

  

 We’re not a perfect place – but we’re a people place. Our priority is supporting all of the different realities our people face. Life is about so much more than work. We get it. That’s why we’ve designed our total rewards to give you the flexibility to choose what you need, when you need it, making sure that you and your family are supported not only financially, but physically and emotionally too. Visit the link below to discover why we’re a great place to work and what being part of more means for you.
   

  

  

  

 https://www.morethanacareer.energy/cbs
   

  

  

  

 If you're full of energy, fired up about sustainability, and ready to craft not only a better tomorrow, but a better you, then come and find your purpose in a team where your voice matters, your growth is non\-negotiable, and your ambitions are our priority.
   

  

  

  

 Help us, help you. We would love for you to share any information about yourself throughout our recruitment process so that we can better understand you and help shape your journey.

* Please apply if you are located in Poland*** We are a disruptive, leading, and innovative SaaS company developing software and services that revolutionize how clinical trials are managed and new drugs are brought to market. Established in 2012, we have taken the Pharmaceutical industry by storm and are looking for exceptional individuals to help us ride the wave of growth we are seeing. As part of our continuous growth, new product introduction and market expansion, we're seeking additional Back-End Engineer's to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will collaborate with skilled engineers, Squad leads, and our lead application architect to find elegant and manageable solutions to new and complex product needs. As a member of the Engineering team, you will join a friendly and talented group of Backend Software Engineer, within a dynamic scale-up company facing great engineering challenges. **What You Will Be Doing** * Build robust and scalable software using Python * Refactor and perform code review * Solve complex performance problems and architectural challenges * Mentor junior team members * Work with the product and design teams to understand end-user requirements, formulate use cases, and then translate that into a pragmatic and effective technical solution * Increase test coverage via unit tests and integration tests * Analyze challenging problems and successfully deliver results **What You Need For This Position** * Experience (5+ years) interfacing with databases (SQL and/or NoSQL), with web-frameworks (Pyramid or equivalent), following best practices (testing, design patterns, etc) * A strong background in OOP in at least one of the following languages: Python, Java, C# or C++ * Your passion and curiosity about new technologies (languages, frameworks, etc) and your understanding of API structures and REST architecture * Master’s degree (or equivalent) in Computer Science/Engineering * Willingness to become a Squad Leader **Nice to have** * Your experience with container orchestration and/or microservice architecture * Your experience in implementing SAAS/Cloud based solutions would be a big plus, as well as experience in software networking (ZeroMQ, RabbitMQ, Websockets) and continuous integration is a plus * Good in at least one of the following: Street Fighter, FIFA, Kicker (foosball) or Darts * A constant desire to improve, to learn more and take things to the next level! *Oh, and by the way, we don’t need a cover letter!* **Top Reasons to Work with Us** * Flexibility is part of our DNA and you’ll find at CluePoints you can work 100% from home or chose to come to the office any day * If you choose to come to the office, you’ll discover a fun atmosphere with kicker, PS4, arcade machine, nerf battles, and our newly added dartboard * If you feel like a change of scenery, we have recently added the option to work at co-working spaces throughout Belgium. * Many activities are organized during the year, such as soccer, team lunches, happy hours, , LAN parties, board games nights! We also have running groups, languages lessons, and much more! * You’ll be working within a squad organization offering you ownership on projects, and utilize high quality equipment like powerful laptops with 64Gb of RAM, an i9, and a 2K screens * At CluePoints, learning, training and personal growth are part of the game: you’ll have access to online training materials, certifications sponsored by the company, personal growth plans, and career paths to explore new opportunities. * You’ll work with a fast-growing, multi-disciplinary and international team representing over 20 different nationalities, in an English-speaking working environment. * You’ll have a challenging and rewarding job in an ambitious and fast-paced technology scale-up that has received many national and international awards including “Scale-Up of the year 2019”! * Last but not least, we offer competitive salary and benefits, company car, bonus potential, employee referral program. **Our Technical Stack** * Python * Angular * Pyramid/Flask * MySQL, MongoDB, Redis * RabbitMQ, Celery * Docker * Gitlab * Kubernetes, Helm, Terraform * Azure

**Job Title:** 
 Data Platform Engineers
 



**Location** 
 : Brussels, Belgium
 



**Duration** 
 : 3 Months with extension
 



**Languages** 
 : Dutch or French and English
 



**Work mode** 
 : Hybrid
 



  





**Job Description:** 



* You are primarily responsible for the development and management of a modern, holistic data platform built in the Microsoft Azure cloud. Furthermore, as an IT Custodian, you are a key member of the "Data Platform" team, ensuring the design, implementation, and advanced optimization of the big data processing pipeline it contains.
* Within the Data Platform team, you are responsible for the following aspects:
* You mainly work on the processing and transformation of the platform's generic data, focusing on the collection, integration, storage, and logic from various data sources at the client office.
* You perform data analyses, modeling, and collaborate with Data Scientists to scale up machine learning models and algorithms, or in the context of advanced and ad\-hoc analytics.
* You are responsible for optimizing performance issues and maintaining the platform to ensure optimal operation.
* Because you hold a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science or a related field involving big data, and you have at least 5 years of experience with data pipelines, cloud technologies, and strong skills in data modeling and data warehousing.



  





**Because you are familiar with the following technologies or concepts:** 



* Apache Spark, Python, notebooks
* Azure DevOps CI/CD pipelines
* Microsoft SQL or DBT
* Azure Data Platform Stack, including:


1. Synapse Analytics
2. Lakehouse
3. Fabric
4. Semantic Model
5. Power BI


* Experience with cloud computing, data engineering, big data processing, performance tuning
* Azure Data Platform architecture



  





**Three reasons why this position is for you:** 



1. You are an expert in Azure data platforms, experienced with Azure \& Fabric technology, and skilled in data pipeline performance and optimization.
2. You are familiar with DevOps methodology, which you will apply in your daily tasks.
3. You are naturally analytical and enjoy solving complex problems.



  





**Roles** 



* ConfirmedData Engineer (ETL/ ELT)



  





**Skills** 



* Apache Spark
* Azure DevOps
* CI/CD pipelines
* Microsoft SQL
* Power BI
* Python

**🐼 Who we are**
**You. Better. With Alan.**
 Alan's vision is to make prevention the new norm of care for all.
 **Our mission is to help people live in good health to 100 while helping employers feel proud, turning health benefits from a cost centre into their most valuable investment.**
 We're building a
 **vertically integrated health partner** 
 that seamlessly unites insurance and smart healthcare delivery into one system.
   

  

 By connecting all aspects of care \- private, public, and direct to consumer \-
 **we create the most member\-centric healthcare experience.** 
 Through deep engagement, we empower everyone to overcome day\-to\-day health obstacles and live healthier lives.
   

  

 We partner with
 **32,000\+ companies** 
 of all sizes, serving more than
 **700K members** 
 , and have reached
 **€500M\+** 
 in ARR.
   

  

 Our team of
 **600 people** 
 (still growing) operates across
 **France 🇫🇷, Spain 🇪🇸, Belgium 🇧🇪, and Canada 🇨🇦.**
**🤘 How we do it ?**
**About**
 People joining Alan are often surprised and delighted by our innovative working method. We have a set of cultural values that guide our approach to work, such as:
   

  

* **Mission is the Boss:** 
 We have a mission\-first focus with long\-term thinking, where all employees act as owners seeking the company's success above all else.
* **Member \& Customer\-led:** 
 We are obsessively focused on solving customer problems and creating delightful experiences while building trust.
* **Excellence like Athletes:** 
 We maintain high standards and talent density, using the Keeper Test to ensure exceptional performance.
* **Enlightened Despots:** 
 We combine distributed ownership with accountability, empowering decision\-makers while maintaining responsibility.
* **Radically Transparent:** 
 We make information accessible and written\-first, promoting async communication while protecting sensitive data.
* **Kind, Methodic Optimists:** 
 We collaborate genuinely without ego, support teammates, and maintain positive intent while assuming the best.
* **Empathetic Challengers:** 
 We give direct feedback with empathy, praise strengths, and focus on growth through candid communication.
* **Bold \& Creative Contrarians:** 
 We think differently to achieve greatness, challenge expertise with first principles, and embrace calculated risks.
* **Disciplined Executors:** 
 We focus on making good decisions quickly, maintain accountability, and break down problems into manageable pieces.
* **Fight for Simplicity** 
 : We eliminate unnecessary processes, stay concise and articulate, and maintain smart frugality while solving problems pragmatically.


**⭐ The Engineering team ⭐**
 In our engineering team, we build the infrastructure, interfaces, and applications to provide first\-class service to our members, health professionals, and even ourselves!
   

  

 Being an engineer at Alan means joining a team of talented, committed and passionate engineers, with a lot of product interaction.
   

  

 We move fast, with a lot of ownership, and are proud to tackle big problems!
   

  

 We do security as we do everything else — that is, not quite the traditional way, but always in line with our leadership principles.
   

  

 Joining Alan as a Security Software Engineer team means you're at the forefront of protecting sensitive health data and ensuring our systems are resilient against threats.
   

  

 Want to know more? Read this article on our Engineering career path.
   

  

 🤖 The Tech Foundations area
   

  

 🎯
 **Mission** 
 : Tech Foundations enables Product Crews to experiment and ship product increments quickly, fostering product quality and reliability with security as a nonnegotiable attribute.
   

  

**🔭 Scope:**
* Infrastructure enablement for product crews (e.g. hosting improvements, CI/CD, ...)
* Security and compliance facilitation (e.g. authentication, database anonymization...)
* Developer productivity enhancements (e.g. local environment setup, monorepo tooling, custom CLI and dashboards ...)
* Design and development unification (e.g. Design System, ...)


**👀 Focus for 2025:**
*(You can learn about some of the things* 
*we did in 2024 in this blogpost)*
 In 2025, we will grow the team significantly to further increase our impact. We want to improve the quality of our foundations, from Infrastructure to code foundations (backend/frontend/mobile). We also have ambitions around our Security stack and enhanced tools and processes for developers.
   

  

**🔄 A quick note about the process:**
 While you’re applying for a particular area, please note that you may ultimately join a different part of our engineering organization, depending on where we believe you will have the most impact.
   

  

 ⭐️
 **Is it you we’re looking for?** 
 ⭐️
   

  

 We are looking for experienced Security Engineers to help us strengthen our security posture across our engineering organization:
   

  

* Strong background in application and infrastructure security. Application Security Testing and Penetration Testing are not just buzzwords for you, you have hands\-on experience using these techniques to identify and mitigate security vulnerabilities in web and mobile applications.
* Experience in protecting organisations from cyber threats and have experience working with platforms to monitor, detect, and respond to security incidents.
* Passionate about building secure products and systems.
* Familiarity with cloud security and modern web application security


 You would be a good fit at Alan if most of this sounds like you:
   

  

* Well\-versed in Object Oriented Programming such as Python, Java, C\#, and enthusiastic about web technologies such as modern JavaScript.
* Willing to work in Python/JavaScript (but you don’t need to have experience with those 2 languages!).
* Passionate about building products.
* Self\-starting and entrepreneurial.
* Humble and still willing to grow (no matter your seniority!).
* Collaborative, enthusiastic about teamwork, learning, and teaching.
* Fluent in English (no need to speak French!).


 For this opportunity, we are aiming to hire within the D\-F level range.
   

  

 But above all, we are looking for high potential and curiosity: make sure to show us this when you apply! Everything else is a bonus.
   

  

 🙌 Perks \& Benefits
   

  

 At Alan, we believe that
 **being in good health is a basic need** 
 , and it starts with our employees. This is why Alaners are provided with a stimulating environment and perks ensuring they are
 **happy, efficient and spend only high\-quality time** 
 with co\-workers.
   

  

**Therefore, we offer:**
* **Fair rewards** 
 . Generous equity packages complement your base salary, for permanent contracts only.
* **Flexible Office** 
 . Amazing office space at our HQ, sponsored co\-working hubs or a full\-remote experience with home office equipment sponsorship, we want you to live where you’re the happiest.
* **All the tools you need** 
 . Top of the range equipment: Macbook Pro, keyboard, laptop stand, monitor, and Bose noise\-canceling headphones.
* **Flexible vacation policy and flexible working hours** 
 . Organize your time as you wish.
* **Delightful healthcare insurance:** 
 Extremely comprehensive health insurance \- 100% for you and your children, 90\-100% for partners depending on your country (permanent contracts only).
* **Transport** 
 . Country\-specific commuter benefits.
* **Learning \& Training opportunities** 
 . A highly flexible Training policy free books and budget to attend and speak at conferences if the opportunity arises.
* **Personal growth through coaching** 
 : At Alan, coaching isn't just a perk \-
 
 it's core to who we are. Every Alaner is paired with a dedicated coach from day one, who helps maximize their impact, nurture engagement, and navigate Alan's values to develop their full potential.
 
**Learn more about our coaching culture** 
**.**
* **Parental leave** 
 . Extended parental leave for all new parents, for permanent contracts only.

**Job Title: Data Engineer** 




**Location: Brussels, Belgium** 




**Duration: 3 Months** 




**Language: English, Dutch OR French** 




**Work Mode: Onsite** 




  





**Job Description** 




  





**What is your mission?** 



* You are primarily responsible for the development and management of a modern, holistic data platform built in the Microsoft Azure cloud. Furthermore, as an IT Custodian, you are a key member of the "Data Platform" team, ensuring the design, implementation, and advanced optimization of the big data processing pipeline it contains.



**Within the Data Platform team, you are responsible for the following aspects:** 



* You mainly work on the processing and transformation of the platform's generic data, focusing on the collection, integration, storage, and logic from various data sources at the Client.
* You perform data analyses, modeling, and collaborate with Data Scientists to scale up machine learning models and algorithms, or in the context of advanced and ad\-hoc analytics.
* You are responsible for optimizing performance issues and maintaining the platform to ensure optimal operation.



**Why can you make a difference?** 



* Because you hold a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science or a related field involving big data, and you have at least 5 years of experience with data pipelines, cloud technologies, and strong skills in data modeling and data warehousing.



**Because you are familiar with the following technologies or concepts:** 



* Apache Spark, Python, notebooks
* Azure DevOps CI/CD pipelines
* Microsoft SQL or DBT
* Azure Data Platform Stack, including:
* Synapse Analytics
* Lakehouse
* Fabric
* Semantic Model
* Power BI

**Vacature: Senior Azure Data Engineer**
**Regio Antwerpen \- hybride** 




 Voor een toonaangevende organisatie in volle digitale transformatie zijn wij op zoek naar een ervaren
 **Azure Data Engineer** 
 . Je maakt deel uit van een groeiend Data \& AI\-team en werkt aan de opbouw van een moderne dataomgeving gebaseerd op
 **Azure Databricks** 
 . In deze rol krijg je zowel strategische als technische verantwoordelijkheid in het realiseren van schaalbare, veilige en performante data\-oplossingen.
 



**Wat ga je doen?** 



* Integreren van databronnen via
 **APIs, ODBC, Event Hubs, sFTP**
* Ontwikkelen van
 **ETL/ELT pipelines** 
 met Azure Data Factory \& Databricks
* Toepassen van
 **Medallion Architecture** 
 (Bronze, Silver, Gold)
* Bouwen van datamodellen (star schema's, SCD's) voor analyse \& operationele rapportering
* Zorgen voor een veilige dataomgeving via
 **RBAC** 
 en
 **Unity Catalog**
* Optimaliseren van pipelines en implementeren van
 **CI/CD** 
 via Azure DevOps
* Samenwerken met data scientists, IT\-collega's en business stakeholders
* Meewerken aan strategische projecten rond digitalisering, AI en data\-integratie



**Wat breng je mee?** 



* Minstens
 **5 jaar ervaring** 
 als Azure Data Engineer of gelijkaardige rol
* Grondige kennis van
 **Azure Data Factory** 
 ,
 **Databricks** 
 en
 **Azure Storage**
* Sterke skills in
 **SQL** 
 ,
 **Python** 
 en datamodellering
* Ervaring met formaten zoals
 **Parquet** 
 en
 **JSON**
* Bekendheid met AI/ML\-integraties op Databricks is een troef
* Bachelor of Master in IT, Computerwetenschappen of gelijkaardig
* **Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Engineer Associate**
* Talen:
 **vloeiend Nederlands en Engels** 
 (Frans is een plus)
* Kennis van
 **Power BI** 
 is mooi meegenomen



**Wat typeert jou?** 



* Analytisch sterk \& detailgericht
* Klant\- en resultaatgericht
* Sterk in samenwerking en communicatie
* Passie voor innovatie en technologie



**Wat mag je verwachten?** 



* Een uitdagende en veelzijdige
 **voltijdse functie** 
 met veel verantwoordelijkheid
* Een organisatie in volle groei waar
 **mensen en initiatief centraal staan**
* Tal van opleidingskansen en ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling
* **Aantrekkelijk loonpakket** 
 met uitgebreide extra\-legale voordelen
* **Hybride werkregeling** 
 : moderne werkplek in regio Antwerpen \+ 2 dagen thuiswerk
* 40\-urenweek met
 **12 ADV\-dagen extra verlof**
* Werken in een vooruitstrevend team met sterke collegialiteit en kennisdeling



**Interesse?**
 Stuur je cv of neem contact op voor meer info. We bekijken graag samen of dit een goede match kan zijn!

N\-SIDE Careers
 **Junior Optimization Software Engineer**
 We are looking for a
 **Junior Optimization Software Engineer** 
 to join our
 **Energy** 
 department based in
 **Louvain\-la\-Neuve** 
 .
   

  

**Who We Are**
 N\-SIDE is a world leader in increasing the efficiency of life sciences and energy industries by providing software and services that optimize the use of natural resources, facilitating the transition to a more sustainable world.
   

  

 To achieve this, N\-SIDE leverages its deep industry knowledge, technical expertise, and understanding of applied mathematics to help global pharmaceutical and energy companies anticipate, adapt, and optimize their decisions.
   

  

 In Energy, we accelerate the transition towards renewables and electrification by enabling leading grids and market players in making better, faster and safer decisions.
   

  

 N\-SIDE is driven by a diverse team of over 200 passionate engineers, computer scientists, and business experts from 30\+ different nationalities, with 25% holding PhDs. Together, they are committed to making a meaningful impact toward a more sustainable future.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Together with the N\-SIDE team, you will design, develop and maintain Optimization software code base related to the Energy Domain. For instance, you will contribute to the development of innovative market clearing solutions for energy market operators (see for example the Euphemia algorithm);
* You will participate in ensuring the scalability, robustness and high performance of our Energy applications, while always seeking and integrating client feedback;
* You will interact closely with business experts and the product users to continuously refine our value proposition and ensure a good market fit.


**About You**
* You have a master in Applied Mathematics and a strong background in Optimization and Operations Research;
* Young graduates are welcome;
* You have programming knowledge in Java/Python and are familiar with object\-oriented programming;
* You have a strong interest in the design, valorisation and use of diverse advanced analytics techniques;
* Experience in the Energy sector, in particular electricity markets and power systems operation, is a nice\-to\-have;
* You are customer\-minded, rigorous and results\-driven;
* You have a great team spirit, creativity, sense of initiative and responsibility;
* You are fluent in English, other languages are a plus.


**Travel** 
 : 0%
   

  

**Start date:** 
 October 2025
   

  

**Our offer**
 What’s important for us is that you grow and learn, because we care about you, which is N\-SIDE’s hallmark.You will be part of a fun and flexible work environment in which creativity, freedom and initiative are rewarded.
   

  

 You will join a diverse team of over 200 passionate engineers, computer scientists, and business experts from 30\+ different nationalities, with 25% holding PhDs. Together, we are committed to making a meaningful impact toward a more sustainable future.
   

  

 N\-SIDE offers a great compensation package, which includes a company car and full range of benefits which can be personalised thanks to our Flex Income Plan.
   

  

 All candidates will be treated equally without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, citizenship, disability, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law. N\-SIDE will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics.
   

  

 We are headquartered in Belgium with offices in the USA and Japan. The company is certified B Corporation, Best Managed Company by Deloitte Belgium and ISO 27001\.
   

  

**Motivated to join our team and bring N\-SIDE to the next level?**
**We are looking forward to receiving your application!**
 We are committed to respecting your privacy and protecting your personal data, including any information which allows us to identify you as an individual person. N\-SIDE uses the applicant’s personal data in a fair and lawful manner. N\-SIDE collects and processes personal data in accordance with the privacy statement available in the privacy policy. Personal information (applicant data) submitted by an applicant will only be used by N\-SIDE to ensure an effective recruitment process and will be used for recruitment purposes only.

Our client is a leading organization that recently celebrated a significant milestone, demonstrating strong financial growth and commitment to their community. They strongly emphasize sustainable and responsible practices, engaging with the public through innovative projects and initiatives aimed at social, cultural, and sports support. With a burgeoning digital presence, their app has become increasingly popular, reinforcing their connection with users.
   

  

**Your Mission**
 As a pivotal member of the Data Platform team, your primary responsibility will be the development and management of a comprehensive data platform hosted in the Microsoft Azure cloud. You will act as an IT Custodian, ensuring design, implementation, and advanced optimization of the big data processing pipeline.
   

  

 Specifically, your responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Processing and transforming the platform's generic data by overseeing data collection, integration, storage, and logic from various sources.
* Conducting data analyses and collaborating with Data Scientists to enhance machine learning models and algorithms.
* Optimizing performance and maintaining the platform to guarantee optimal operation.


**The Ideal Candidate**
 You are a qualified professional with a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science or a related field, bringing at least 5 years of experience in data pipelines and cloud technologies. Your expertise includes strong data modeling and data warehousing capabilities, along with familiarity with:
   

  

* Apache Spark, Python, and notebooks
* Azure DevOps CI/CD pipelines
* Microsoft SQL or DBT
* Azure Data Platform Stack, including Synapse Analytics, Lakehouse, Fabric, Semantic Model, and Power BI
* Cloud computing, data engineering, big data processing, and performance tuning
* Azure Data Platform architecture


**Why This Position is Right for You**
 This role is perfect for you if:
   

  

* You are an expert in Azure data platforms and have experience with Azure \& Fabric technology, particularly in data pipeline performance and optimization.
* You are well\-versed in DevOps methodologies, applying them in your daily tasks.
* You possess a natural analytical mindset, thriving on solving complex problems.

**Company Description**
 Sopra Steria offers tailored, end\-to\-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56\.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe’s leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.
   

  

 The world is how we shape it. Let’s shape it together.
   

  

**Job Description**
 As a PowerBI consultant, you will help our clients solve complex BI issues. You collect data from different sources,build sustainble datamodels, optimize datasets for reporting and develop user\-friendly PowerBI dashboards. Based on your own expertise and the Sopra Steria BI methodology, you increase the quality of reporting and visualization at our customers. In addition, your input will contribute to the vision and development of our Data Visualization team.
   

  

 Understanding data is important. With the Sopra Steria solution for Data visualization, we help organizations do just that. We do this by visualizing information and data. We make abstract information accessible and understandable. Based on the right insights, we can then make data driven decisions about next actions Microsoft technologies such as PowerBI, Fabric, Azure, ... hold no secrets for us.
   

  

 Within our Data Visualization team we want to help each other and keep learning from each other. We do this by working closely together within the team. So are you looking for new challenges with great colleagues and a steep learning curve? Then the Data Visualization team at Sorpa Steria is the right place for you.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 We’re seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries in digital transformation and technology consulting. At Sopra Steria, you’ll have the opportunity to grow your skills in a constructive, collaborative team environment, working on impactful projects that drive change for our clients. If you thrive on challenge and meet (most of) the qualifications below, we look forward to your application!
   

  

**You’ll have knowledge and experience of the following:**
* You have at least 3 year of experience with data visualization and can demonstrate this with a demo or portfolio
* You have at least 3 year demonstrable experience with PowerBI
* You have experience with performance tuning of PowerBI solutions
* You dare to be creative, but do not lose sight of the details
* Knowledge of best practices and visual design principles
* You act as an expert and coach people
* You communicate fluently, both with your colleagues and the customer
* A good knowledge of data modeling and dimensional modeling concepts..
* Knowledge of HTML/CSS and programming languages such as javascript, python, C\# is also a plus
* Data visualization is your passion
* Adding your dashboards or portfolio in the application is a plus
* Knowledge of exernal tools like Tabular editor are a plus
* You are proficient in English and Dutch and/or French


**What We Can Offer You**
 As a member of one of Europe’s largest digital solutions providers, you’ll benefit from extensive career development opportunities, both local and international. At the Sopra Steria Academy, you’ll be part of a dynamic network of 56,000 professionals at all stages of their careers.  Je vertaalt businessnoden naar duurzame datastructuren die makkelijk te interpreteren én onderhouden zijn. Dankzij jouw expertise kunnen collega’s bouwen op een betrouwbare, goed georganiseerde datastructuur. Jij bent de stille kracht achter onze data driven decisions.

 je bouwt de fundamenten waarop data scientists en analisten kunnen bouwen: van data lakes tot geavanceerde ETL\-processen en governance\-compliant structuren.

**Your Impact**
 As an OptimusAI Data Science Specialist, you will help leading companies across the Energy and Materials sector unlock their full productivity potential using AI.
   

  

 Collaborating in a dynamic, multi\-disciplinary team of 3\-6 experts, you will use your creativity and analytics expertise to enhance client performance in areas such as energy efficiency, product quality, and capacity. You will be working side\-by\-side with the client’s process engineers and analytics specialists and will be communicating your work to executive audiences.
   

  

 Internally, you will collaborate with our talented product engineers to develop innovative products and algorithms to address current and future client needs. You will help codify best practices, radiate our impact in/externally and shape the product roadmap.
   

  

 Along the way, you will benefit from world\-class training in business problem structuring and client advisory, while working closely with senior manufacturing and analytics experts. Experience unparalleled career growth with significant ownership and responsibility from day one, all within a collaborative, diverse, and non\-hierarchical environment. Seize the opportunity to travel to client sites, locally and around the world.
   

  

 You will be based in our Brussels office as part of McKinsey’s manufacturing AI solution (OptimusAI), which sits at the intersection of three practices: Global Energy and Materials, QuantumBlack and Operations.
   

  

 Global Energy and Materials: advises production and investor companies across chemicals \& agriculture, paper \& packaging, metals \& mining, oil \& gas, and power generation on strategic, operational, and growth issues.
   

  

 QuantumBlack, AI by McKinsey: the AI arm of our firm which helps clients transform faster, innovate smart, and anticipate the future.
   

  

 Operations: assists our clients in solving complex operational challenges by developing and implementing operational strategies, initiatives and solutions for their most critical problems. Connecting boardroom strategies to the shop floor operators.
   

  

 At the intersection of these groups, OptimusAI is a team of \~10 expert consultants, data scientists and engineers, focused on improving processing plant productivity through data analytics.
   

  

 We develop real\-time AI advisory systems to support decision making in the plant control room, assess and optimize process control systems, and we unlock plant bottlenecks through data\-driven process changes.
   

  

 OptimusAI supports a global community of consultants by developing an innovative machine learning toolkit and codifying the approach to deliver significant and lasting client impact.
   

  

 Ready to deliver direct impact on some of the world's largest industrial players? We invite you to submit a cover letter detailing why you are the perfect fit for our team and how you can contribute to our mission!

**About**
 Een goede patiëntenzorg is het rechtstreekse gevolg van betrokken en tevreden zorgverstrekkers.
   

  

 Dat is het uitgangspunt van het Universitair Ziekenhuis Brussel.
   

  

 Elke dag gaan er meer dan 4200 medewerkers geïnspireerd aan de slag, en dit over alle niveaus van onderhoud, administratie, verpleging, ICT, ... tot topchirurgie.
   

  

 Functieomschrijving UZ Brussel: Samen sterk in zorg, innovatie en wetenschap
   

  

 Word onze nieuwe Data Engineer op de ICT dienst
   

  

 UZ Brussel is een toonaangevend universitair ziekenhuis in het hart van onze hoofdstad. Wij zijn een warm en vooruitstrevend ziekenhuis waar innovatie, onderzoek en patiëntgerichte zorg hand in hand gaan. Elke dag zetten bijna 5\.000 medewerkers zich in om onze missie waar te maken: zorg bieden die niet alleen uitblinkt in kwaliteit, maar ook in menselijkheid.
   

  

 Wil jij met jouw talent het verschil maken voor onze patiënten? Dan ben jij de collega die we zoeken! Voor de ICT dienst zoeken we een gedreven Data Engineer die samen met ons de zorg naar een hoger niveau tilt. Maak deel uit van ons team en bouw mee aan zorg die inspireert!
   

  

 Hoe maak jij het verschil?
   

  

 Als Data Engineer op de ICT dienst draag jij niet alleen bij tot kwaliteitsvolle dienstverlening, maar ook aan de warme, persoonlijke benadering waar UZ Brussel bekend om staat.
   

  

**Wat Ga Je Doen**
 Je versterkt het UZ Brussel ICT team dat instaat voor de ontwikkeling van data\-gedreven producten, van het Clinical Data Warehouse tot innovatieve toepassingen van AI en Data Science;
   

  

 Als data engineer bouw je aan een solide DataOps framework dat d.m.v. data pipelines de volledige levenscyclus van data\-intensieve producten ondersteunt – van het efficiënt ontsluiten van de nodige data uit diverse bronnen tot het vlot operationaliseren in een productie\-omgeving;

**Your future job** 




 As a Data Engineer at Melexis, you will be a key player in building our future data architecture and in realizing a multitude of data\-related projects. You will become an expert in state\-of\-the\-art data infrastructure (capturing, analyzing, maintaining) and be part of the team responsible for designing and developing:
 



  




* our state\-of\-the\-art hybrid cloud data infrastructure,
* data pipelines from a multitude of systems towards our cloud platform,
* data processing systems (on\-site and in the cloud) for both structured and unstructured data,
* advanced conceptual, logical and physical data organizations, models, repositories, dashboards and reports.



  





 This specific Data Engineer role focuses on the centralization and unification of the data coming from the different product development teams, such as product characterization measurements, various simulations, as well as contextual meta\-data. Key responsibilities will include gathering and processing the data from the diverse source systems coming in different formats, as well as centralizing the data in our cloud environment. These data play a crucial role across different business units, requiring you to collaborate and effectively communicate with many stakeholders to fulfill their project and data requirements.
 



  





**Your profile** 



* You have a bachelor's or master's degree in IT or Engineering (or equivalent experience), preferably with at least 3 years of experience in a similar role.
* You have practical knowledge of and experience with data processing, and data engineering technologies, tools, and platforms (e.g., PySpark, SQL, ETL using Databricks).
* You have experience working with structured as well as unstructured datasets.
* Hands\-on Python programming skills
* Experience in cloud computing (Azure/AWS/GCP)
* You possess excellent communication, analytical, and critical thinking skills. You can express complex matters precisely and concisely and see the bigger picture while understanding nuances.
* You have a strong interest in engineering and research and are passionate about building data solutions in a state\-of\-the\-art environment. You are eager to learn and grow in a high\-tech company.



  





**We offer** 



* The opportunity to be a key player in building the future of data architecture and driving impactful data\-related projects.
* The chance to become an expert in modern data infrastructure, working with hybrid cloud solutions and advanced data processing systems.
* The opportunity to grow in a dynamic, international high\-tech company, with ample professional development opportunities.
* The chance to contribute to company success in a team\-oriented, enjoyable, and professional atmosphere within a flat organizational structure.



  





**Diversity \& Inclusion** 




 Melexis is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.
 



  





**About Melexis** 




 Inspired by a passion for technology and engineering, Melexis designs, develops and delivers innovative micro\-electronic solutions. They enable designers to turn ideas into applications that support the best imaginable future. The company’s advanced mixed\-signal semiconductor sensors and actuators integrate sensing, driving and communication into next\-generation products and systems. They improve safety, raise efficiency, support sustainability and enhance comfort.
 



  





 Melexis is a world leader in automotive sensors. Today, on average, every new car produced worldwide contains 18 Melexis chips. Melexis uses this expertise to serve other markets as well: alternative mobility, smart appliances, smart buildings, robotics, energy management and digital health.
 



  





 Melexis is headquartered in Belgium and employs over 2000 people in 18 locations worldwide. The company is publicly traded on Euronext Brussels (MELE).

**Join Axon and be a Force for Good.**
 At Axon, we’re on a mission to Protect Life. We’re explorers, pursuing society’s most critical safety and justice issues with our ecosystem of devices and cloud software. Like our products, we work better together. We connect with candor and care, seeking out diverse perspectives from our customers, communities and each other.
   

  

 Life at Axon is fast\-paced, challenging and meaningful. Here, you’ll take ownership and drive real change. Constantly grow as you work hard for a mission that matters at a company where you matter.

 As a Sr. Robotics Software Engineer, you’ll contribute to advance Axon’s mission to Protect Life, by building software for advanced, Mission\-Critical robots like UAVs, UGVs, etc.
   

  

 Development environments include C/C\+\+, Rust, Python, ROS2 and Gazebo.

**Job Description**
 As Stephen Few states: “We are overwhelmed by information, not because there is too much, but because we haven't learned how to tame it.”
   

  

 Capgemini Data \& AI is looking for people who tame data in such a way that the most complex data can be easily interpreted.

In this role, you will be responsible for designing and implementing modern data solutions that support advanced analytics, reporting, and business intelligence initiatives.
   

  

**YOUR ROLE**
* Develop and maintain scalable data pipelines using Microsoft Fabric.
* Work with OneLake, Dataflows Gen2, and Lakehouse architectures.
* Collaborate with cross\-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver solutions.

 De functie
   

  

 Als Software Development Engineer bent u verantwoordelijk voor het gehele traject van ontwikkeling en werkvoorbereiding van het besturingsprogramma van logistieke systemen voor de glastuinbouw. Voor het ontwikkelen van nieuwe programma modules wordt gebruik gemaakt van Visual Basic .Net. Het ontwerpen en inrichten van Databases gebeurt met behulp van Microsoft SQL Server.  You will collaborate with R\&D, product management, and compliance teams to assess risks, define security requirements, and support our alignment with security regulations and standards, including NIS2, CRA, and IEC 62443\.

 Furthermore:

 Hybrid, Brussels, start: 1 Sep till end of year (extension possible)
 



  





**Fonction** 




 Vous travaillerez au sein de l’équipe « BICC » (Business Intelligence Competency Center), une équipe pluridisciplinaire dont la mission essentielle consiste à mettre à disposition de l’entreprise de l’information de qualité pour supporter la prise de décision par le management.
 



 Votre principale responsabilité consistera à concevoir, développer, maintenir et supporter la solution business intelligence (BI) / data warehouse (DWH), plus particulièrement sous l’angle de l’intégration des flux de données.
 



 Pour ce faire, vous collaborerez étroitement avec les analystes BI de l’équipe, qui auront recueilli les besoins des utilisateurs et traduit ceux\-ci en spécifications fonctionnelles et modèles de données.
 



 Vous accomplirez vos tâches conformément aux principes d’architecture en vigueur et aux règles et bonnes pratiques établies, tout en contribuant à l’amélioration continue de celles\-ci.
 



 Vous jouerez également un rôle actif lors des différentes phases de tests pour valider les développements de la plateforme DWH et vous serez le garant d’une documentation technique applicative maintenue à jour.
 



  





**Profil** 



* Vous êtes titulaire d’un master en informatique ou disposez d’une expérience équivalente. Vous souhaitez entretenir et développer vos connaissances informatiques et avez un goût prononcé pour les activités orientées data.
* Vous disposez d’une expérience professionnelle de minimum 3 ans dans un environnement BI/DWH et/ou lié à des activités de data management.
* Vous maîtrisez le SQL et pouvez démontrer une première expérience probante de développement de flux ETL, idéalement avec la technologie SAS (DI Studio).
* Vous êtes familier avec une large variété de types de sources et de formats de données.
* Une première connaissance (appliquée) des principes Agile (SCRUM) constitue un atout, de même qu’une première exposition professionnelle au secteur financier.
* Vous possédez une compréhension du fonctionnement des outils de scheduling pour la gestion du plan de production IT de l’entreprise.
* Vous maîtrisez parfaitement le Français et/ou le Néerlandais (C2\), et vous avez une bonne maîtrise de l’autre langue nationale ainsi que de l’Anglais (B2\).
* Vous disposez de solides compétences analytiques et savez faire montre d’une approche structurée. Vous contrôlez votre travail, êtes soucieux du détail et de la performance de votre code et êtes capable d’analyser les impacts de votre travail sur l’ensemble de la solution BI/DWH.
* Vous comprenez les bénéfices et les attentes du travail en équipe, et êtes également capable de fonctionner en autonomie. Vous êtes proactif et savez faire preuve d’initiative dans le respect du cadre fixé (standards et procédures).
* Vous pouvez estimer de manière réaliste et raisonnable la charge de travail nécessaire à l’accomplissement d’une tâche, et vous y tenir.
* Vous êtes flexible, persévérant et résistant au stress.



  





**Offre** 



* Vous rejoindrez un groupe 100 % belge et indépendant, coopérative et mutuelle, à taille humaine, et où vous pourrez rapidement avoir un impact.
* Vous ferez partie de notre culture d'entreprise typique et spécifique : nos employés et anciens employés apprécient l'ambiance positive et agréable et l’approche collégiale.
* Vous intégrerez un groupe où le management est accessible et proche de ses employés.
* Vous travaillerez dans nos bâtiments caractéristiques au cœur de Bruxelles, à proximité de la Grand\-Place et de la gare centrale



  





 If this sounds like tailor made for you, please send your CV, day rate and availability for a call to gregor@clearsource.eu

**What are we looking for?**
 At Devoteam, we believe cyber is about creating a more secure future for our customers. Our IAM consultants leverage methodologies of a digital identity platform to help clients control which employees, partners, suppliers, customers, and citizens have access to sensitive organizational applications and data. We also focus on the integrations of cutting\-edge technologies in the digital identity space. Our team is dedicated to enhancing IAM programs so our clients can mitigate risk, reduce intrusion, and secure information. If you're seeking a career in IAM, cloud systems, or identity governance then this career opportunity is right for you.
   

  

**What will your day look like?**
 As an IAM Security Consultant at Devoteam, you'll play a crucial role in designing, implementing, and managing IAM solutions for our clients. You will work with a variety of technologies and protocols. You will be involved in all stages of the project lifecycle, from initial assessment to deployment and ongoing support.
   

  

**Responsibilities?**
* Design, implement, and maintain IAM systems and solutions.
* Conduct security assessments and vulnerability testing related to IAM.
* Develop and maintain documentation for IAM processes and procedures.
* Provide expert\-level support and troubleshooting for IAM issues.
* Stay current with the latest IAM trends, technologies, and best practices.
* Collaborate with cross\-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of IAM solutions.
* Communicate effectively with clients to understand their needs and provide solutions.
* Contribute to the development of internal knowledge and training materials.


  

  

**Qualifications**
  

**We Hire for Attitude and Train for Skill…**
 The person we are looking for combines the qualities of a good communicator and an expert in the domains of Information Security, Cybercrime, and IT. The more boxes you can tick in the list below, the closer you match the ideal profile we are looking for.
   

  

**Required Skills and Experience:**
* Strong understanding of IAM concepts, including authentication, authorization \& access control.
* Experience with Linux and Windows operating systems.
* Familiarity with networking fundamentals and security concepts.
* Knowledge of IAM protocols such as OAuth 2\.0, OpenID Connect, SAML, and LDAP.
* Experience with IAM products such as Ping/Forgerock, Keycloak, or Active Directory.
* Scripting skills in Bash, Python or other languages.
* Excellent communication \& interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Willingness to learn and adapt to new technologies
* Aware of the information Security space and related compliance frameworks (Data Protection Act, NIS2, EU AI act, GDPR, NIST, OWASP,...
* You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and have a good working knowledge of English


**Desired/Preferred skills and Certifications:**
* Master’s degree in computer science/Engineer/Cyber Security or relevant work experience in IT Security.
* Information Security Certifications are nice to have
* Experience with containerization technologies like Docker or Podman.
* Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and tools like Jenkins.
* Experience with monitoring tools like Logstash, Prometheus, and Grafana.
* Experience with Git.

 Data Migration Engineer

 Your tasks \& responsibilities
   

  

 As a Data Migration Engineer, you will support the IPCOM group companies on their ERP journey in ensuring their data is migrated from their legacy systems into their new systems correctly and completely. Your goal is to make sure the local companies can start working with these new systems and processes without questioning the data.
   

  

* You build qualitative migration solutions (from blueprint to execution).
* You embed our data migration approach into our ERP and/or CRM implementations.
* You gather the migration requirements from the business in line with the technical constraints.
* You develop ETL flows to support the data migration (extraction, enrichment, cleansing, standardization, validation and load).
* You ensure the data quality of the solution for all requirements (functional and technical).
* You ensure the correct and efficient migration of data for our applications.
* You take the lead in the creation of data migration and cut\-over plans.
* You take the lead in the creation of the data migration designs and architecture.
* You will work closely with various teams and stakeholders to ensure all data is migrated correctly and efficiently.


 Your profile
   

  

* You hold a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent by experience.
* You have minimum 5 years of hands\-on data migration experience, preferably with regards to ERP and/or CRM implementations.
* Sound knowledge of Data Factory / Microsoft Fabric / Python / SQL.
* Knowledge of Power BI, Power Automate, Azure Functions, Power Apps and Logic Apps is considered a strong plus.
* You have hands\-on experience with building and maintaining SQL scripts and Python Code — this knowledge is expected to be readily available.
* You are capable of independently setting up data source connections (databases, APIs, OData feeds, file\-based sources,…) — and designing data load processes, taking into account security best practices and minimizing the impact on production systems.
* You are experienced in designing and executing data migration processes where business interaction, validation and input are integral parts of the data transformation automation.
* You have the necessary knowledge in Azure cloud technologies.
* Having hands\-on experience in managing Microsoft Dynamics migration and Azure DevOps are considered as a plus.
* Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
* You have the ability to work independently, as well as in project teams.
* You take ownership and responsibility.
* You think in terms of solutions and results.
* You are a clear and effective communicator.
* Fluent in English. Knowledge of any other language is a plus.


 Our offer
   

  

* The opportunity to develop yourself and grow in the role/in the team

**Who are we?**
 In today’s digital world, organizations need to shift their approach to cyber security. Prevention alone is no longer sufficient! There is an ever growing need to have rapid detection and response capabilities in place. Organizations are looking at trusted strategic partners to offer the valuable expertise and knowhow, to fully unburden them in the domain of detection and response. That’s where we come in. We offer MDR as a value service to a multitude of customers across different verticals – all equally exciting.
   

  

 Based in Belgium and the Netherlands, we are committed to helping companies navigate the digital era and make data\-driven decisions. We serve clients in the top 200 across the Benelux, spanning a wide range of fascinating and diverse sectors.
   

  

 At Davinsi Labs, we love to inspire each other, collaborate closely, and pursue excellence together. We are building a workplace where fulfillment and happiness take center stage.
   

  

**Your mission: what can you expect from the job?**
 You Will Be a Part Of Our MSP Teams Focusing On Managed Detection \& Response (MDR) Services. Your Primary Objective As An Engineer Will Be To Continuously Enhance Our Platform, Data, Threat Detection And Threat Response Capabilities Across Different Complex Customer Environments And Offer Our Customers ‘the Comfort Of Knowing’. Your Expertise And Performance Will Directly Impact The Experience Of Our Valued Clients. The Applicable Technologies Are The Following
   

  

* Splunk Enterprise \& Splunk Enterprise Security
* Palo Alto XSOAR
* Microsoft Sentinel
* Microsoft Defender XDR


**Key Responsibilities**
* Research: Researching new methods to find malicious behaviour in customer environments, simulating them and translating the outcome into actionable detection.
* Best practice frameworks: Creating and continuously improving detection use cases, rules, and analytics. You also map these use cases to best\-practice frameworks such as MITRE ATT\&CK.
* Detection rule lifecycle management: Development, activation and fine\-tuning of detection rules for customers. Maintaining the entire library in a version control system (Git) and simulating heat maps for customers to analyse detection coverage and gaps.
* Incident Response and Detection: Testing detection capabilities by simulating attacks in a lab environment. Validating detection capabilities on live customer environments and collaborating with the Incident Response teams to identify next steps, investigation, and response playbooks.
* Data management \& monitoring: Development, activation \& maintenance of functionalities like data parsing, data routing, data masking, data normalisation, data monitoring, etc. Our DMM library also needs to be maintained in our version control system.
* Platform lifecycle management:The availability of data \& detection rules will, of course, not be ensured if the threat detection platform is designed, developed and operated properly. Managing, monitoring and optimizing this is key in order to ensure its reliability, scalability, and performance. The team implements best practices and industry standards to enhance the security and integrity of our customer data platforms.
* Documentation: Develop high\-quality documentation to establish repeatable and reproducible processes, ensuring consistency across all teams.
* Serving as a subject matter expert: Providing guidance and support to internal teams, clients \& vendors on the technical aspect of the products used in our MDR offering. Continuously staying up\-to\-date with the latest advancements and trends in the ecosystems.

Depending on your role and expertise, you may be asked to provide Quality \& Compliance support during audits and inspections, or to join a Sopra Steria validation service team.
   

  

 As a trusted Computerized System Validation (CSV) Engineer, you play a key role in the validation process of the computerized systems used by our clients in the Life Sciences sector. More specifically, your mission is to ensure the quality and regulatory compliance of GxP systems throughout their entire life cycle and across all GxP areas (GLP, GCP, GMP, GDP, GPvP). Systems in scope can include site\-specific lab instruments (e.g. HPLC software) and production equipment (e.g. capsule filling machine), but also globally used web applications, Clinical Trial Management Systems, complex Manufacturing Execution Systems, SAP systems, medical devices, etc…

* Analytical and pragmatic thinking skills
* Strong prioritization and planning skills
* Strong sense of responsibility and accountability
* A positive, solution\-driven mindset
* Excellent written and oral communication skills in Dutch and English

* A team player, but also able to work independently
* Familiar with applicable regulatory standards and guidelines (21CFR Part 11, EU Annex 11, GDPR, GAMP5, ISO 9001,...) and concepts such as QMS, CAPAs, Data Integrity,... .
* Familiar with applying validation methodologies (Waterfall, Agile) within a GxP environment.

 Senior Shipping Data Analyst \- Asia Pacific
 



  





 Do you have the drive and aptitude to turn ideas into reality? Do you share our passion for the environment and harnessing technology to decarbonise our society? Do you love number crunching? We are looking for a Sustainable Shipping Analyst. This is a role based in Europe but with a specific focus on shaping new policies in the Asia\-Pacific (APAC) region.
 



  





 The position requires a person with strong analytical, coding and research skills. Communicating complex data in a way that is both accessible and impactful is key for our advocacy. The successful candidate will demonstrate the ability to carry out technical analyses related to maritime transport and alternative fuels using T\&E’s Excel and Python\-based models, and to translate them into simple and persuasive data and policy messages.
 



  





 In 2025, we are expanding our operations into the Asia\-Pacific region, with Singapore \- the world’s largest transshipment and bunkering hub \- as our starting point. We are looking for a candidate to be based in T\&E’s Brussels office (experienced candidates based in London or Paris may also be considered), who will support colleagues in our APAC offices with technical
 



 analysis, data and research.
 



  





  





 Main functions of the role:
 



  





 ● Being a key part of T\&E’s Shipping and Trends \& Analysis teams, focusing on our analytical work for the APAC region on maritime transport.
 



 ● Researching and analyzing technological and economic aspects of energy efficiency, alternative energy, such as hydrogen, synthetic fuels, and electricity, for ships and ports.
 



 ● Analyzing and dissecting data as well as complex policy issues from a variety of sources including scientific studies, reports and models.
 



 ● Developing briefings and inputting into advocacy and campaign materials based on robust data, evidence and argumentation in order to reduce the climate impact of maritime transport in the Asia\-Pacific region.
 



 ● Presenting T\&E’s technical analyses to policymakers, business leaders, civil society actors and our international network.
 



  





  





  





 The following skills are essential to be considered for the position:
 



  





 ● Strong knowledge of Excel and Python and experience in working with these tools.
 



 ● At least 2\-4 years of experience working with models and data in the shipping/transport, environmental or energy sectors.
 



 ● Good communication, presentation and data visualization skills.
 



 ● The ability to write in English fluently, accurately and concisely.
 



 ● Flexibility and willingness to work with colleagues across the globe. Occasional travel may be required as part of the role.
 



 ● The confidence to think and act with initiative, to engage and influence policymakers, industry representatives and other stakeholders.
 



  





  





 Additionally, the following skills and knowledge are desirable:
 



  





 ● Experience working closely with stakeholders in Asia\-Pacific countries.
 



 ● Asian languages (e.g. Mandarin, Indonesian, Japanese, Korean) are considered a bonus.
 



 ● Project management experience including strong interpersonal and team\-working skills and a track record in delivering to tight deadlines.
 



  





  





  





 Practicalities
 



  





 This is a permanent, full\-time position based in Brussels. While we offer a very flexible working environment, the successful candidate will be expected to spend at least two days per week in the office. Candidates with proven and relevant experience could also be based in Paris or London in exceptional circumstances. For candidates based in those cities, there is an
 



 expectation that they will spend several days per month in Brussels.

 Do you thrive in Agile environments and want to help ensure seamless IT operations even during critical events? If you’re excited to tackle real challenges in disaster recovery and continuity planning, then this opportunity is for you.
   

  

 Join a forward\-thinking security and infrastructure team that places resilience at the heart of its digital transformation journey. As a
 **Resiliency/IT Continuity Engineer** 
 , you’ll play a critical role in ensuring IT systems can withstand disruptions and continue to deliver essential services to millions of users.
   

  

**Your Mission**
 As a key member of the
 **Resiliency/IT Continuity team** 
 , your mission is to safeguard the organization’s ability to recover from critical IT incidents. In this role:
   

  

* You will drive initiatives to maintain and test IT resilience across business\-critical systems and data centers.
* You will coordinate and validate key deliverables such as Application Impact Analyses (AIA), Continuity Run Books (CRBs), and Disaster Recovery (DR) Unitary Test documentation.

* You will build, coordinate, and maintain the Master Run Book (MRB) by consolidating all critical actions from the individual CRBs.
* You will facilitate live disaster recovery exercises—typically conducted during weekends or overnight—ensuring a smooth and effective execution.


 You have the following skills

* You have at least 5 years of experience in one or more of the following roles: Resiliency Engineer, Security Engineer, Infrastructure/OPS Engineer, or Solution Architect.

* You have excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, and are social, assertive, and proactive in your interactions.
* You’re able to review and interpret architecture and technical diagrams, particularly from a resiliency and failover standpoint.
* You can remain calm and focused under pressure, independently managing priorities and deliverables.
